title: Citi Launches Award-Winning Electronic Banking Platform for Institutional Clients in Singapore
summary: Singapore - Citi today announced the launch of CitiDirect Banking Evolution (BE<sup>SM</sup>), its next-generation electronic banking platform for institutional clients, in Singapore. The platform addresses the key challenges institutions face around accessing timely, accurate, relevant and easy to understand information so that new opportunities can be identified and prompt decisions can be made to improve business outcomes.
tag-1: Citi Launches Award-Winning Electronic Banking Platform for Institutional Clients in Singapore
tag-3: Singapore – Citi today announced the launch of CitiDirect Banking Evolution (BESM), its next-generation electronic banking platform for institutional clients, in Singapore. The platform addresses the key challenges institutions face around accessing timely, accurate, relevant and easy to understand information so that new opportunities can be identified and prompt decisions can be made to improve business outcomes.
tag-4: Building on the CitiDirect® online platform that was first introduced more than a decade ago, CitiDirect BESM represents a multi-year, multi-million dollar investment to provide clients with an integrated suite of solutions, beyond traditional transaction management and reporting services.
tag-5: Citi's institutional clients can access the electronic banking platform through three channels -- desktops/laptops, smartphones and tablets*. The channels have different features to meet the distinct requirements of financial professionals with different job functions and requirements within an organization.

tag-8: Melvyn Low, ASEAN Head for Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions, says: "Citi is a clear leader in transaction banking with our global footprint and strong relationships with clients. However, the competitive landscape is rapidly evolving. It is absolutely critical that we continue to innovate, and invest in new technologies and capabilities to create solutions that guide our customers through the complexities of their operating environment and empower them to make strategic business decisions."
tag-9: "Today, the digitization of both money and information is one of the most important mega-trends ever to impact financial institutions and our customers. Citi is committed to becoming the digital bank of the future, to create more value for our customers and deepen our relationships with them."
tag-10: Anita Loh, Singapore Head, Product Management for Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions, adds: "We are very excited about the launch of CitiDirect BESM in Singapore. The revolutionary platform has moved beyond basic transaction banking functionalities which are widely provided in the market today. Clients can expect a totally new experience with its contemporary design, intuitive user interface and enhanced analytic capabilities which will significantly improve their decision-making abilities."
tag-11: The CitiDirect BESM platform and its modules have won numerous awards since their launch, such as "#1 Electronic Banking Platform for Corporates" in 2012 by Greenwich Associates, "Best Overall Internet Bank" in 2012 by Global Finance, "Innovation in Cash & Treasury Technology" in 2012 by The Banker and "Overall Most Innovative" in 2012 at the Monarch Innovation Awards. The platform serves over 80 percent of the Fortune Global 500 companies, supports over 60,000 clients globally and 16,000 in Asia.
tag-12: Citi Treasury and Trade Solutions enables our clients' success by providing an integrated suite of innovative and tailored cash management and trade finance services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and public sector organizations across the globe. Based on the foundation of the industry's largest proprietary network with banking licenses in over 100 countries and globally integrated technology platforms, TTS continues to lead the way in offering the industry's most comprehensive range of digitally enabled treasury, trade and liquidity management solutions. As of the second quarter of 2013, average deposits and other customer liability balances were $415 Billion. Average trade loans were up 16 percent YoY.
tag-14: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
